definition[0]: a bent tube used for getting liquid out of a container, used by holding one end of the tube at a lower level than the end in the container
definition[1]: a type of bottle for holding soda water, which is forced out of the bottle using gas pressure
definition[2]: to remove liquid from a container by using a siphon
example[0]: It took him only a few minutes to siphon off the petrol and drive away.
example[1]: Crews began siphoning oil from the leaking boat.
definition[3]: to dishonestly take money from a business, account etc to use it for a purpose for which it was not intended
example[2]: Emergency aid was siphoned off by foreign ministry officials for their own use.
example[3]: I found she had siphoned thousands of dollars from our bank account.
definition[4]: to dishonestly take money from a business, account etc and use it for a purpose for which it was not intended
example[4]: I later found she had siphoned thousands of dollars from our bank account.
example[5]: Corrupt officials had been siphoning off public funds for private business ventures.
